name: Allan Pulker
reviews:
Not as good as it used to be. Plastic panels between customers and barista, cramped indoor seating and main seating area has been taken over by business-related activities.

However the espresso is still excellent!

It is, alas, no longer my first choice among the various caf√©s in my neighbourhood.

name: Gabriela
reviews: Hands down the best cortado I've ever had! Happy to see gluten free options available! Grabbed a gluten free brownie and it was not very sweet.

name: Yeung Stephenie
reviews: I ordered a cup of soy milk latte and a cup of earl grey tea, the girl ended up giving me a cup of earl grey tea with soy milk.

name: Simon W
reviews: I would pass by and notice a sign advertising they had ice cream so I decided to give it a try. I'm sure the coffee is great given the reviews, but their ice cream cone was very sad. Would not recommend their ice cream.

name: Tarek Ghaly
reviews: Cozy place that I found by coincidence!! I took the wrong metro and found this hidden gem.. coffee is very nice and bakeries too..staff are very friendly and prices are reasonable..

name: Joe Adragna
reviews: I'm a coffee flavored coffee kind of guy. The best coffee I've had in a long time!

name: Mike W
reviews: Great coffee.  Great snacks.

name: Rebby Jacobs
reviews: Super friendly staff and such a cozy vibe. I had an absolutely delicious vegan sausage roll and cappuccino!

name: Amir Ghaffari
reviews: The have remarkable coffee and great ambiance, they roast their own coffee and I always ask the them to grind fresh for me ,,,,I do recommend , I believe is family run business‚Ä¶.

name: Toronto Psychology
reviews: Love the fresh Pastries

name: Rekha
reviews: It's okay, nothing special at all. Also, me and three other friends got the exact same drink with no modifications and were somehow charged different amounts before tip. Will not be returning.

name: R H
reviews: Can‚Äôt beat fresh pastries with a double shot

name: Andy Dabydeen
reviews: Excellent coffee shop and roaster. Yes, they have teas and lots of tasty baked goods as well.

name: Amin Rahmani
reviews:
This was the right place to walk into.
The friendly gent brewing the bean made such a good Americano, I had to stay and have another. Second one was iced since it was so hot out, perfect.
I mentioned to him how I liked that it wasn‚Äôt very acidic, and he pointed out some of the reasons behind it, which were very cool to learn.
Followed that up with the mixed berry muffin I had been eyeing earlier. It had a PROPER amount of berries, which is just the way I like it.
Even managed to get a good amount of work and reading done while listening to the very chill jazz playing in the background.
I‚Äôll definitely make this a regular hangout on my days in town. There are two more muffins I‚Äôm eyeing for my next visit :D

name: smriti Khanna
reviews: It was the best coffee i have had in Toronto so far. Strong and refreshing!

name: Satarupa
reviews:
Had a really good glass of their Ethiopian Cold Brew with notes of Chocolate and Caramel, was refreshing and strong at the same time.
Enjoyed it with a Butter Tart(without raisins), the filling was a tad too sweet for my taste but fresh and good quality.
Overall, would surely revisit to try their other remarkable bean coffees :)

name: Elham Yaesubi
reviews: I like this place. The products are really delicious and they're all really fresh

name: Jerry Higgins
reviews: I feel they are one of the best places to buy roasted coffee beans in Toronto. Good selection of beans  and roasts available. Their beans are my go to for the Aeropress. Food is also great. Service at this location is impeccable and staff here are very friendly.

name: Alejandra
reviews:
Out of all the pretentious Queen street coffee shops this is one I would urge you not to go here.

I‚Äôve been here several times in the last couple of months because I wanted to give them a chance but nope, still the same awful service every time.

I was just there and the person serving me clearly had no interest in being there and shows no service etiquette. My standards are not high, but all I‚Äôm saying is I‚Äôve received better service at Burger King.

I give them 2/5 because at the very least they have a good selection of food which most coffee shops nowadays don‚Äôt seem to offer.

I would be happy to come back to this Queen staple if their staff integrated manners into work ethic and accepting cash would be a plus!

name: Doyour Part
reviews: Exceptional coffee, service and tarts! Great atmosphere and vibes

name: Rob Norris
reviews: Such a cool place for coffee of snack or baked goods!

name: M T
reviews: Good espresso at a reasonable price. Strong with a smooth ending. Decor was rustic. Barista was pleasant. Many options for pastries and dessert. Had a peanut butter cookie...one of the best, it was 1 inch thick! Hard to choose only one item for a treat. Many options for alternatives other than coffee and cookie.

name: dan lendvay
reviews:
Fantastic shop...great service..OHHHHHHMG delicious pastries....wonderful decor...so unique...forget the chain shops if you live in the area or are passing by...

Stop in...I regret the past years being around and not trying this place sooner!!

name: M Sorkhabi
reviews:
Friendly staff, good coffee, ok pastry. Prime location: Right on the beach. Doesn‚Äôt have indoor seating but there are a few bistro sets outside; you can also get your coffee to go, enjoy it on the beach. They have loose leaf tea and coffee beans for purchase.
I tried the shortbread cookies; they are thin and taste ok. I wouldn‚Äôt get it again, but the coffee yes!

name: Michael Anhorn
reviews: They have the best whole bean coffee I‚Äôve fond in Toronto and they are very friendly and helpful!

name: Timothy Roy Walks
reviews: Great place. I recommend the French vanilla latte on a cold day.

name: Quiet City Design
reviews: I don't get to the east side of Toronto to often, so I don't know the local shops as well. I popped into Remarkable Beam on a whim to pick up coffees for a client meeting. George (owner) was very friendly and accommodating. The coffee is great, and the homemade muffins are a great way to start the day. I'll be back next time I'm in the area!

name: Christina Garner
reviews: Not only is this the BEST coffee in the area, the customer service is friendly, familiar and welcoming. Their treats are fresh and delicious and they‚Äôre serious about the quality of their coffee beans. Would highly recommend.

name: Arhum A
reviews: Well deserving of this 5 star rating for George. Food and coffee are always fresh and George is always extremely welcoming.

name: Corey Mueller
reviews: George is a solid guy. The coffee ‚òï  and vegan sausage roll is absolutely amazing. My new spot in the morning.

name: Sal Celestial
reviews:
The carrot cake is incredible!!!
I have to try the rest :)

name: David Banh
reviews: Ordered the matcha latte. There was barely any flavour of the matcha, drank it when I got home. It tasted like microwaved milk with a hint of green tea.

name: Maria Vaysman
reviews: Delicious pastries and drinks!! Great service! Easy to purchase thru a window (great if you have a dog and cant come inside) üòä ‚Ä¶

name: Andrea Kavanagh
reviews: Picking up my beverages here in their great little curb side hub during Covid in my neighborhood has made my days a little brighter. You guys make the BEST matcha latte in the area!

name: Nicole Knight
reviews: I ordered three different coffee blends from their online store. They shipped really quickly.  The 25th Anniversary blend is perfect and I can't wait to try the other two!

name: Karen T
reviews: Purchased their espresso beans, latte and mince pies. Absolute treat of a place!

name: Kirstie
reviews: My go to for fresh ground coffee. This cute little local spot in Queen East is a gem! Curb side purchase is easy peasy and I will continue to supportüòÅ ‚Ä¶

name: Alex Winch
reviews: Great coffee  and friendly, relaxed staff. If you want a total indulgence,  go for the cranberry muffins.

name: Raoul R.V.
reviews: Great freshly roasted coffee beans.

name: Effie Panagiotopoulos
reviews: Great coffee and great atmosphere! Baristas very friendly and knowledgeable @

name: Ramon Martinez
reviews: Great espresso, kind staff

name: aa aa
reviews: Service was friendly and Lucas was very amicable. Coffee was great and staff is knowledgeable of products

name: John Armstrong
reviews: Quiet, amiable staff

name: Matt West
reviews: Great coffee, chill vibe

name: Rob Mandel
reviews: Expensive, but good coffee. Nice decor

name: Ruan Marcus
reviews: Friendly service and really enjoyed the hot-chocolate and butter-tarts

name: Dennis Mantin
reviews: George is as fab as ever!

name: B1 Laxson
reviews: Its a cozy dive in the wonderful sort of way.

name: Tanya Stander
reviews: I have been drinking El Zipa coffee from the Remarkable Bean for about 4 years now and I can honestly say this is still my favourite coffee in Toronto (and beyond)! I‚Äôve never had a bad bag of coffee and everyone who drinks it comments how incredibly delicious it is. We just use it in a pour over and it works every time. Delicious! What a joy it is to receive a fresh bag of this coffee delivered to my door every week!!! Keep up the beautiful roast guys!!!

name: Kameron -
reviews: Good food options and coffee is consistent. Need a ramp of stroller but prob not possible

name: Peggy Maki
reviews: enjoyable environment.

name: Sheena Yap Chan
reviews: A cute coffee shop in Leslieville with some yummy food such as their vegan sausage roll.  Friendly staff and price is reasonable.

name: Dave Hersh
reviews: Good coffee....mediocre comedy

name: Fuad Fikret
reviews: Service was perfect.I asked from the guy what was his favourtie,he suggest us Carrot Cake,and yes he was right!!Thank you guys

name: Fanny Tran
reviews: I don't thing me and my husband went here.

name: Morgan Dobroshinsky
reviews: Stopped by for the first time yesterday morning since my power was out at home and got myself a coffee and one of the mini quiches. The coffee was great, and the quiche would have been if it wasnt still cold in the centre. The place is really cute but I found it odd that there was no background music going?!

name: CA H
reviews: Great coffee and delicious pastries. Lovely staff. Temps inside the cafe can get very hot due to oven.

name: Robbin Hudson
reviews: Great coffee selection, roasted on site, friendly service. Cozy laid back comfortable  with super treats.

name: Nancy Macedo
reviews: Parking was tough to visit the Remarkable Bean. Our decision to still make attempts to stop and enjoy the coffee were based on other reviews and how highly other thought about the place. I found it really average. The place is cute and you can find seating but its awkward at times. I think the owner needs to review seating arrangements - there are definately ways to maximize space without compromising a cozy atmosphere. The coffee was good but was average. I got the rocket fuel coffee and a oatmeal cookie - just average and nothing else to write about. My guess is that its a good  neighborhood spot as it became a bit busy with 1 served who managed drinks, orders, and cash. However, I don't think I'll go out of my way again.

name: Edward Bennett
reviews: Good tea & coffee nice people.

name: Mike Riberdy
reviews: Great tasting coffee, nice little shop.

name: Ume Maharukh
reviews: Went to the Remarkable Bean for some iced coffee but unfortunately they currently dont have an ice machine :(. Ended up trying their vegan coconut walnut cookie and it was very nice! Hopfully they expand their vegan options. Great prices and lovely workers!

name: Hospitality Consulting
reviews: Always good. Keep up the great work!

name: Cathy Bogaart
reviews: Good coffee (even the decaf - had a flat white). Good music. Comfy seating. Wifi sketchy. Lovely friendly staff.

name: Adrian Frai
reviews: Great lattes

name: Bill D.
reviews: I buy a bag of Rocket Fuel about once a week. John remembers my name now. Peanut butter cookies - huge and deeeelicious. Be there early to get them. They don't make many and blink and they're gone.

name: Julian Sammy
reviews: The man behind the counter, out of the goodness of his heart, made me a little cup of tea as I was leaving. He'd heard me coughing earlier. That was on top of excellent coffe in a spacious, well maintained store. Oh - and the smell of roasting coffee in there and on the street? Amazing.

name: Desmond B
reviews: Dope ambience, great selection of teas and coffee, and their vegan broccoli cheese muffin is on point

name: Ryan Sim
reviews: Great coffee joint, good location. Go Friday nights for Mike Payne's amazing comedy show!

name: Danielle Tessaro
reviews: delicious coffee, friendly service, great location. Love this place!

name: Robert Smith
reviews: Delicious coffee

name: Sydney Westgate
reviews:
My family and I are frequent customers at the Bean both in Leslieville and the Beaches. Not only is the coffee AMAZING (they roast their own btw) but the desserts are delicious. I suggest trying the ButterTart, they are the best in town! They also have a wide range of gluten free products and some vegan which is nice to have :)

As I said before, the coffee is wonderful. The owner's, as well as one very charming barista with a mighty fine beard, roast their own beans in house. The coffee is strong, not acidic and smooth. Rocket Fuel is my go-to! The espresso is creamy with caramel undertones. Just by the taste of your drink, you know the roasting is done expertly and the staff are well trained when it come's to steaming milk and pouring espresso shots. The staff are also extremely friendly and quirky - don't let the sometimes sarcastic wit steer you away! The Remarkable Bean is certainly unique and the staff are no different. There is jazz music playing in the background and velvet purple, yellow and red pillows.

Everyone who goes to the Bean is also kind. You can certainly tell that in the Leslieville location, almost everyone is a regular and the owners are familiar with many of their customers. Speaking of the owners, the Bean is a family run company and if you are grabbing a coffee from either location you are bound to see them. They care about their store, their customers and their staff. They are, in my opinion, a very "hallmark" type of family and if you know hallmark, that means they are kind, charming and passionate about what they do.

If I was going to recommend a coffee shop in Toronto to someone, my first suggestion is always the Remarkable Bean! It may be located outside of the downtown core, but it's worth the trip! My family doesn't live in the area but still choose to swing by the bean when in need of a coffee-fix. Trust me when I say you can't go wrong :)

ALSO they have comedy on friday nights!! BONUS

name: jeremy yaksich
reviews: Comedy night every Friday! Can't miss! And free of charge. Awesome.

name: Aoiffe Walsh
reviews: Friendly staff, open late at night which is perfect for getting some work done. It‚Äôs a quiet spot that do good drinks. Every Friday evening they host a free comedy show which is worth checking out.

name: Dan Brennan
reviews: best mocha I ve ever had

name: Brigitte McCann
reviews: Cranberry blueberry muffins to die for. Very cozy and jazzy atmosphere with industrial type decor. Back patio for outdoor calm in the sun. Coffee lovers: I had their flat white and it was delish. Would definitely come back here!

name: Mo Chan
reviews: Great coffee

name: nicol cotton
reviews: good coffee and homemade snacks, nice vibe too.

name: Lara Saliba
reviews: A great cafe! It's a cute, cozy small design that draws you in and encourages you to settle in and set up shop with a good book or your laptop for a few hours. It's snug, warm, and the wood features and exposed brick wall add a nice style to the place. What stood out the most to me at this shop was the warm atmosphere and the friendliness - not only of the staff, but also of the other patrons! I got excited when I saw it as I thought the name was very adorable, and wanted to take a picture in front of it - I tried to be quick and not block anyone's way but people were also so nice and understanding!

name: Nedim Barut
reviews: Nice and relaxing environment

name: Dmitry Romanenko
reviews: Good coffee, cozy place and welcoming staff. Big plus for late hours. I wish it was closer to downtown tho.

name: Laura S. M.
reviews: Loved the vibe here! Not to mention the best Americano I've had in Toronto yet üòÆüíØ‚òï ‚Ä¶

name: Ramon Angelo Bayani
reviews: It's a small place but it's very quaint. Good for studying or working.

name: Liann Sherbin
reviews: Really great in-house roasted coffee!  Papua New Guinea us our fave.  Cozy and relaxed atmosphere.

name: Joel West
reviews: Lovely quirky coffee shop in Leslieville

name: Paul Duffy
reviews: The gluten free brownie is incredible

name: M B
reviews: Cozy coffee shop with a friendly barista.

name: Jose Rodriguez
reviews: I really enjoyed the place. I ordered a London Fug tea with a cookie. Service is fast and is a cozy place to warm up. Definitely I'll go again to test their variety of dessert.

name: Jeff V
reviews: Jose, good to hear!

name: Tiger Powers
reviews: Best decaf coffee I've ever had.   Their regular java is exquisite too

name: Tim Butson
reviews: Thanks Jeff!

name: Lilac Ca√±a
reviews:
Good medium roast coffee, cosy interior to hang while listening to Jazz music that's been played & enjoy a ‚òï..
Beans re local roasted, üôè hands up love it!!!
There is two locations both on Queen East, one at the Beaches, this one in Leslieville.
I've been to both of em several times..
And will continue to go whenever iam nearby üëå.
Vegetarian/vegan friendly offering soy&almond milk and some vegan snacks as well.

name: Adam Wilson
reviews: Thanks Tiger!

name: Davin McMahon
reviews: Great service. Great coffee. Neat place.

name: Uriel Andreazza
reviews:
The barista working said I looked like Joel McHale

10/10 would feel handsome there again

name: Bahram
reviews: Adam, great to hear!

name: Dani
reviews: Rocket fuel is the best coffee

name: Prashant Goel
reviews: Good to hear, thanks Franz!

name: Adrian Huisman
reviews: Good atmosphere, okay coffee.

name: Jason Davis
reviews: Lovely spot and friendly staff! Great wifi to get some work done too, and brightly lit

name: Ben Chapman-Smith
reviews:
Went there for the first time today. Got a medium roast coffee (No light roast). It's pretty good. But the service was cold. No wave no thank you and I wasn't done paying that the next person was being served. (1 or 2 person behind me).

Thing is, there's like 3 coffee shops within 2mn walk from this place that look all equally good. So while I gave it 4 stars, I'm not sure it really deserves it.

name: Andrea H
reviews: Very nice coffee shop on Queen East in Toronto.  Good quality coffee and a nice, comfortable area to sit and enjoy, along with one of their tasty pastries, of course!

name: Gaby Abed
reviews: Good

name: Vincent Mok
reviews: Pretty good coffee, chill vibe

name: Yechan Lee
reviews: Original review: Would be a great coffee shop if the staff was a bit less wiseass.  Coffee is good however and there's usually free samples if you can take the wisecracks that come with. Review one year later: offending person no longer employed it seems. Attended excellent comedy event here.

name: Niall Quinlan
reviews: Love this location! Cozy and neatly decorated space, warm and friendly staff, good selection of beverages, and the homemade snacks are delicious.

name: Walid Saleh
reviews: Super friendly staff

name: Hayden Lives
reviews: There are much better coffee shops in the neighborhood.  The service is usually mediocre,  the buttercup that I've tried was really dry and untasty.  The coffee is OK and the kishes and the muffins are nice.

name: Christophe F.
reviews: Good coffee, quiet space good for conversations

name: Carlton C
reviews: The place was cozy and awesome, but I felt like there is a little shortage of matcha latte. I tried matcha latte, and it was the worst latte I have had before. I don't know how taste the coffe is, but I don't wanna recommand the match latte.

name: The Talos Team in Toronto by Andreas and Nectaria (Nectaria & Andreas)
reviews: Love the vibe in here, a real east side great. The savory muffins are a must

name: Nectaria Kladitis
reviews: Service was friendly & competent. Wares were worth the outlay of cash. Comfortable environment.

name: Anca B
reviews: Friendly staff. Great environment. Good muffins. Only knocked off a star because no latte art.

name: Brian Kennedy
reviews: Excellent coffee and delicious quiches with a nice selection

name: HARRIS LAM
reviews: Best coffee roasted on site baked goods made fresh and delicious every day

name: Aura Events
reviews: Great atmosphere and INCREDIBLE coffee. Working in this area for a few months and have made this a part of my routine. Get one of the muffins.

name: Mike Heron
reviews: Friendly folks making good coffee.  Plenty of room.  What else does one need?

name: Sarah Bruckschwaiger
reviews: Best coffee place everrr

name: Kitzen Hayden
reviews: Best coffee in the beaches hands down.  Their medium americano can't be beat!!

name: Mark Bolusmjak
reviews: Delicious drinks with lots of room to sit and enjoy the atmosphere.

name: Priscilla Mak
reviews: Best coffee in Leslieville- I always buy some for housewarming gifts wherever I go and people are really impressed! Great staff, awesome treats. Wouldn't recommend it for sitting and reading or working/studying however- the music is consistently awful, never changed (I've heard the same group of old CDs repeat 3 times in one afternoon type of thing) and volume is set very loud. I bring my noise cancelling headphones and try and make-do because I love the place so much lol

name: Kathy Nga Ting Ho
reviews: The big tables are great for getting work done

name: Andrea (LabyrinthOnVHS)
reviews: Good lord the baked goods are amazing. The Remarkable Baked Goods didn't have the same ring or didn't fit on the sign. All hail the bean's quiche! See also: chocolate chip muffin et al.

name: Pedram D.
reviews: Great coffee, good selection of treats and lunch items (sandwiches, quiche, etc.) Good reasonably quiet place to get some work done.

name: Andreas Batakis
reviews: Friendly service, delicious fare

name: Mike Lee
reviews:
Fantastic service! Te Aro is just always busy so I ventured eastward and fell in love. It's a simple coffee shop with really good pastries. There's good coffee. And there's sandwiches!

The barista actually took the time to explain each bean to me, from harvesting to drying to roasting to flavour profile. EACH bean!! He made sure I picked the right one.

name: Gillian Raymond
reviews: A quiet and cozy spot with fantastic coffee.

name: Spencer Clerk
reviews: Nice cozy place in Leslieville. Relatively good coffee and delicious treats and pastries. Secure wifi, clean bathrooms!

name: Matt Li
reviews: Good coffee, yummy cakes (had a carrot cake. Hmmm!) Nice atmosphere and cool staff. Although s bit hipster audience - but one has to take that for some decent places theses days ;)

name: Sara Bobinac
reviews: This is my personal favorite cafe in Toronto. Nice coffee, nice staff - especially Remarkable John! It is laid back and friendly.

name: Markus Weisshaar
reviews: Decent espresso, lots of savory treats, open late. Service was a bit awkward.

name: Chris Brown
reviews:
Glad to see a RB open up closer to me (not a huge fan of the one in the Beaches).
2 experiences here:
One during this past winter; the staff was excellent, friendly and made a great coffee! we had lattes and sausage rolls to refuel after a long (and cold) run. We were able to find a seat even though it was busy.
One during this past summer; Iced tea was really good (they brew it as you order) but the staff seemed to be new and a bit unsure of them self. The drinks took a long time.

name: Miguel Agawin
reviews: Food is okay. Quiet place to grab coffee in Leslieville.

name: Peter Fung
reviews: Great service, great iced coffee. The day we were there was a pretty slow day so the comedian behind the counter was keeping the spirits light and entertaining us. He made a damn good iced coffee as well. We tried some sweets; a brownie and butter tart, and although the butter tart was a bit too dry the brownie was great. We went to the back patio which was empty to our surprise, on such a nice day. Would go here again!

name: balanced paws
reviews: Friendly crew

name: Steve Keys
reviews: Dark roast is nice and mild. Good quiches and very comfortable place to work.
